15#ifndef DNS_CACHE_H
16#define DNS_CACHE_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file dns/cache.h
23 * \brief
24 * Defines dns_cache_t, the cache object.
25 *
26 * Notes:
27 *\li A cache object contains DNS data of a single class.
28 * Multiple classes will be handled by creating multiple
29 * views, each with a different class and its own cache.
30 *
31 * MP:
32 *\li See notes at the individual functions.
33 *
34 * Reliability:
35 *
36 * Resources:
37 *
38 * Security:
39 *
40 * Standards:
41 */
42
43/***
44 *** Imports
45 ***/
46
47#include <stdbool.h>
48
49#include <isc/json.h>
50#include <isc/lang.h>
51#include <isc/stats.h>
52#include <isc/stdtime.h>
53
54#include <dns/types.h>
55
56ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
57
58/***
59 *** Functions
60 ***/
61isc_result_t
62dns_cache_create(isc_mem_t *cmctx, isc_mem_t *hmctx, isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr,
63 isc_timermgr_t *timermgr, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
64 const char *cachename, const char *db_type,
65 unsigned int db_argc, char **db_argv, dns_cache_t **cachep);
66/*%<
67 * Create a new DNS cache.
68 *
69 * dns_cache_create2() will create a named cache.
70 *
71 * dns_cache_create3() will create a named cache using two separate memory
72 * contexts, one for cache data which can be cleaned and a separate one for
73 * memory allocated for the heap (which can grow without an upper limit and
74 * has no mechanism for shrinking).
75 *
76 * dns_cache_create() is a backward compatible version that internally
77 * specifies an empty cache name and a single memory context.
78 *
79 * Requires:
80 *
81 *\li 'cmctx' (and 'hmctx' if applicable) is a valid memory context.
82 *
83 *\li 'taskmgr' is a valid task manager and 'timermgr' is a valid timer
84 * manager, or both are NULL. If NULL, no periodic cleaning of the
85 * cache will take place.
86 *
87 *\li 'cachename' is a valid string. This must not be NULL.
88 *
89 *\li 'cachep' is a valid pointer, and *cachep == NULL
90 *
91 * Ensures:
92 *
93 *\li '*cachep' is attached to the newly created cache
94 *
95 * Returns:
96 *
97 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
98 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
99 */
100
101void
102dns_cache_attach(dns_cache_t *cache, dns_cache_t **targetp);
103/*%<
104 * Attach *targetp to cache.
105 *
106 * Requires:
107 *
108 *\li 'cache' is a valid cache.
109 *
110 *\li 'targetp' points to a NULL dns_cache_t *.
111 *
112 * Ensures:
113 *
114 *\li *targetp is attached to cache.
115 */
116
117void
118dns_cache_detach(dns_cache_t **cachep);
119/*%<
120 * Detach *cachep from its cache.
121 *
122 * Requires:
123 *
124 *\li 'cachep' points to a valid cache.
125 *
126 * Ensures:
127 *
128 *\li *cachep is NULL.
129 *
130 *\li If '*cachep' is the last reference to the cache,
131 * all resources used by the cache will be freed
132 */
133
134void
135dns_cache_attachdb(dns_cache_t *cache, dns_db_t **dbp);
136/*%<
137 * Attach *dbp to the cache's database.
138 *
139 * Notes:
140 *
141 *\li This may be used to get a reference to the database for
142 * the purpose of cache lookups (XXX currently it is also
143 * the way to add data to the cache, but having a
144 * separate dns_cache_add() interface instead would allow
145 * more control over memory usage).
146 * The caller should call dns_db_detach() on the reference
147 * when it is no longer needed.
148 *
149 * Requires:
150 *
151 *\li 'cache' is a valid cache.
152 *
153 *\li 'dbp' points to a NULL dns_db *.
154 *
155 * Ensures:
156 *
157 *\li *dbp is attached to the database.
158 */
159
160
161isc_result_t
162dns_cache_setfilename(dns_cache_t *cache, const char *filename);
163/*%<
164 * If 'filename' is non-NULL, make the cache persistent.
165 * The cache's data will be stored in the given file.
166 * If 'filename' is NULL, make the cache non-persistent.
167 * Files that are no longer used are not unlinked automatically.
168 *
169 * Returns:
170 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
171 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
172 *\li Various file-related failures
173 */
174
175isc_result_t
176dns_cache_load(dns_cache_t *cache);
177/*%<
178 * If the cache has a file name, load the cache contents from the file.
179 * Previous cache contents are not discarded.
180 * If no file name has been set, do nothing and return success.
181 *
182 * MT:
183 *\li Multiple simultaneous attempts to load or dump the cache
184 * will be serialized with respect to one another, but
185 * the cache may be read and updated while the dump is
186 * in progress. Updates performed during loading
187 * may or may not be preserved, and reads may return
188 * either the old or the newly loaded data.
189 *
190 * Returns:
191 *
192 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
193 * \li Various failures depending on the database implementation type
194 */
195
196isc_result_t
197dns_cache_dump(dns_cache_t *cache);
198/*%<
199 * If the cache has a file name, write the cache contents to disk,
200 * overwriting any preexisting file. If no file name has been set,
201 * do nothing and return success.
202 *
203 * MT:
204 *\li Multiple simultaneous attempts to load or dump the cache
205 * will be serialized with respect to one another, but
206 * the cache may be read and updated while the dump is
207 * in progress. Updates performed during the dump may
208 * or may not be reflected in the dumped file.
209 *
210 * Returns:
211 *
212 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
213 * \li Various failures depending on the database implementation type
214 */
215
216isc_result_t
217dns_cache_clean(dns_cache_t *cache, isc_stdtime_t now);
218/*%<
219 * Force immediate cleaning of the cache, freeing all rdatasets
220 * whose TTL has expired as of 'now' and that have no pending
221 * references.
222 */
223
224void
225dns_cache_setcleaninginterval(dns_cache_t *cache, unsigned int interval);
226/*%<
227 * Set the periodic cache cleaning interval to 'interval' seconds.
228 */
229
230unsigned int
231dns_cache_getcleaninginterval(dns_cache_t *cache);
232/*%<
233 * Get the periodic cache cleaning interval to 'interval' seconds.
234 */
235
236const char *
237dns_cache_getname(dns_cache_t *cache);
238/*%<
239 * Get the cache name.
240 */
241
242void
243dns_cache_setcachesize(dns_cache_t *cache, size_t size);
244/*%<
245 * Set the maximum cache size. 0 means unlimited.
246 */
247
248size_t
249dns_cache_getcachesize(dns_cache_t *cache);
250/*%<
251 * Get the maximum cache size.
252 */
253
254void
255dns_cache_setservestalettl(dns_cache_t *cache, dns_ttl_t ttl);
256/*%<
257 * Sets the maximum length of time that cached answers may be retained
258 * past their normal TTL. Default value for the library is 0, disabling
259 * the use of stale data.
260 *
261 * Requires:
262 *\li 'cache' to be valid.
263 */
264
265dns_ttl_t
266dns_cache_getservestalettl(dns_cache_t *cache);
267/*%<
268 * Gets the maximum length of time that cached answers may be kept past
269 * normal expiry.
270 *
271 * Requires:
272 *\li 'cache' to be valid.
273 */
274
275isc_result_t
276dns_cache_flush(dns_cache_t *cache);
277/*%<
278 * Flushes all data from the cache.
279 *
280 * Returns:
281 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
282 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
283 */
284
285isc_result_t
286dns_cache_flushnode(dns_cache_t *cache, const dns_name_t *name,
287 bool tree);
288/*
289 * Flush a given name from the cache. If 'tree' is true, then
290 * also flush all names under 'name'.
291 *
292 * Requires:
293 *\li 'cache' to be valid.
294 *\li 'name' to be valid.
295 *
296 * Returns:
297 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
298 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
299 *\li other error returns.
300 */
301
302isc_result_t
303dns_cache_flushname(dns_cache_t *cache, const dns_name_t *name);
304/*
305 * Flush a given name from the cache. Equivalent to
306 * dns_cache_flushpartial(cache, name, false).
307 *
308 * Requires:
309 *\li 'cache' to be valid.
310 *\li 'name' to be valid.
311 *
312 * Returns:
313 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
314 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
315 *\li other error returns.
316 */
317
318isc_stats_t *
319dns_cache_getstats(dns_cache_t *cache);
320/*
321 * Return a pointer to the stats collection object for 'cache'
322 */
323
324void
325dns_cache_dumpstats(dns_cache_t *cache, FILE *fp);
326/*
327 * Dump cache statistics and status in text to 'fp'
328 */
329
330void
331dns_cache_updatestats(dns_cache_t *cache, isc_result_t result);
332/*
333 * Update cache statistics based on result code in 'result'
334 */
335
336#ifdef HAVE_LIBXML2
337int
338dns_cache_renderxml(dns_cache_t *cache, xmlTextWriterPtr writer);
339/*
340 * Render cache statistics and status in XML for 'writer'.
341 */
342#endif /* HAVE_LIBXML2 */
343
344#ifdef HAVE_JSON
345isc_result_t
346dns_cache_renderjson(dns_cache_t *cache, json_object *cstats);
347/*
348 * Render cache statistics and status in JSON
349 */
350#endif /* HAVE_JSON */
351
352ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
353
354#endif /* DNS_CACHE_H */
